name: Foundation for a Drug Free Europe
goal: The purpose of FDFE, established in 2004, is preventing and stopping debilitating drug use by educating youth and non-users concerning the harmful effects that drugs can inflict upon the body, mind and personality. The Foundation has also the aims to create and put into action drug prevention projects with governments and institutions, elaborate cycles of conferences, round tables and to focus around the different aspects of the drug abuse in Europe and help create drug free European societies by collaborating with like-minded groups and organisations sharing the same purpose.
interests: Consumer Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, External Relations, Food Safety, Home Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Public Health, Sport, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives:
Member of the Civil Society Forum on Drugs of the European Commission DG Migrations-Home Affairs. Participation to the Working groups.
-
EU Drug Strategy and Action Plan
-
And interest in the decisions of the UNODC - Vienna and of the OSCE.
